Quote: The third-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the majority. The second-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the minority. The first-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking.
Author: A. A. Milne

Quote: History teaches us that men and nations behave wisely once they have exhausted all other alternatives.
Author: Abba Eban

Quote: How many legs does a dog have, if you call the tail a leg? Four. Calling a tail a leg doesn't make it a leg.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: When I do good, I feel good; when I do bad, I feel bad, and that is my religion.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak out and remove all doubt.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: You can fool some of the people all of the time, and all of the people some of the time, but you can not fool all of the people all of the time.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail.
Author: Abraham Maslow

Quote: My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.
Author: Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.

Quote: I use emotion for the many and reserve reason for the few.
Author: Adolf Hitler

Quote: It is always more difficult to fight against faith than against knowledge.
Author: Adolf Hitler

Quote: Do not look where you fell, but where you slipped.
Author: African proverb

Quote: Do you realize if it weren't for Edison we'd be watching TV by candlelight?
Author: Al Boliska

Quote: Any company large enough to have a research lab is too large to listen to it.
Author: Alan Kay

Quote: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we now know and understand, while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: When you look at yourself from a universal standpoint, something inside always reminds or informs you that there are bigger and better things to worry about.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The only thing that interferes with my learning is my education.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The person who reads too much and uses his brain too little will fall into lazy habits of thinking.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Time and space are modes by which we think and not conditions in which we live.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: When you sit with a nice girl for two hours, you think it's only a minute. But when you sit on a hot stove for a minute, you think it's two hours. That's  relativity.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: There are people who, instead of listening to what is being said to them, are already listening to what they are going to say themselves.
Author: Albert Guinon

Quote: When everyone is against you, it means that you are absolutely wrong-- or absolutely right.
Author: Albert Guinon

Quote: An intellectual is a person who has discovered something more interesting than sex.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
Author: Alexander Pope

Quote: Do not confuse motion and progress. A rocking horse keeps moving but does not make any progress.
Author: Alfred A. Montapert

Quote: It is easier to fight for one's principles than to live up to them.
Author: Alfred Adler

Quote: The point of quotations is that one can use another's words to be insulting.
Author: Amanda Cross

Quote: Acquaintance, n.: A person whom we know well enough to borrow from, but not well enough to lend to.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgement that something else is more important than fear.
Author: Ambrose Redmoon

Quote: We don't see things as they are. We see things as we are.
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: It is better to fail at your own life than to succeed at someone else's.
Author: Andr√© Gide

Quote: People cannot discover new lands until they have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
Author: Andr√© Gide

Quote: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.
Author: Andr√© Gide

Quote: It is bad luck to be superstitious.
Author: Andrew W. Mathis

Quote: If the lessons of history teach us anything it is that nobody learns the lessons that history teaches us.
Author: Anon

Quote: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exup√©ry

Quote: What lies in our power to do, lies in our power not to do.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: We are what we repeatedly do; excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit; Genius hits a target no one else can see.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Every nation ridicules other nations, and all are right.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: I'd rather live with a good question than a bad answer.
Author: Aryeh Frimer

Quote: The Argument from Intimidation is a confession of intellectual impotence.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do.
Author: B. F. Skinner

Quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
Author: Baltasar Gracian

Quote: Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.
Author: Barry LePatner

Quote: A government that is big enough to give you all you want is big enough to take it all away.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the men of old; seek what they sought.
Author: Basho

Quote: Trying to determine what is going on in the world by reading newspapers is like trying to tell the time by watching the second hand of a clock.
Author: Ben Hecht

Quote: Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for truth.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goals to reach.
Author: Benjamin Mays

Quote: What happens to the hole when the cheese is gone?
Author: Bertolt Brecht

Quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: No one gossips about other people's secret virtues.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: If a man is offered a fact which goes against his instincts, he will scrutinize it closely, and unless the evidence is overwhelming, he will refuse to believe it. If, on the other hand, he is offered something which affords a reason for acting in accordance to his instincts, he will accept it even on the slightest evidence. The origin of myths is explained in this way.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: The greatest challenge to any thinker is stating the problem in a way that will allow a solution.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.
Author: Bill Cosby

Quote: If at first you don't succeed, find out if the loser gets anything.
Author: Bill Lyon

Quote: Thought is useful when it motivates for action, and a hindrance when it substitutes for action.
Author: Bill Raeder

Quote: An optimist stays up to see the New Year in. A pessimist waits to make sure the old one leaves.
Author: Bill Vaughan

Quote: We learn something every day, and lots of times it's that what we learned the day before was wrong.
Author: Bill Vaughan

Quote: Careful. We don't want to learn from this.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: I really wish I was less of a thinking man and more of a fool not afraid of rejection.
Author: Billy Joel

Quote: I have made this letter longer than usual because I lack the time to make it shorter.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: A single question can be more influential than a thousand statements.
Author: Bo Bennett

Quote: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.
Author: Bob Hope

Quote: The less you know, the more you believe.
Author: Bono

Quote: When the student is ready the teacher will appear.
Author: Buddhist Proverb

Quote: Don't ever wrestle with a pig. You'll both get dirty, but the pig will enjoy it.
Author: Cale Yarborough

Quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.
Author: Calvin Trillin

Quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: Just the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Some people make things happen, some people watch things happen, and some ask what happened.
Author: Casey Stengel

Quote: If you can't be a good example, then you'll just have to be a horrible warning.
Author: Catherine Aird

Quote: You don't get anything clean without getting something else dirty.
Author: Cecil Baxter

Quote: Happiness is the absence of striving for happiness.
Author: Chang-Tzu

Quote: Fight for your opinions, but do not believe that they contain the whole truth, or the only truth.
Author: Charles A. Dana

Quote: The difference between a democracy and a dictatorship is that in a democracy you vote first and take orders later; in a dictatorship you don't have to waste your time voting.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: An inventor is simply a fellow who doesn't take his education too seriously.
Author: Charles F. Kettering

Quote: Bureaucrats write memoranda both because they appear to be busy when they are writing and because the memos, once written, immediately become proof that they were busy.
Author: Charles Peters

Quote: By the time a man realizes that maybe his father was right, he usually has a son who thinks he's wrong.
Author: Charles Wadsworth

Quote: He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
Author: Chinese Proverb

Quote: One dog barks at something. And a hundred dogs bark at the sound.
Author: Chinese Proverb

Quote: I hear: I forget / I see: I remember / I do: I understand
Author: Chinese Proverb

Quote: Asking a working writer what he thinks about critics is like asking a lamppost how it feels about dogs.
Author: Christopher Hampton

Quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
Author: Christopher Morley

Quote: Inspiration is for amateurs. I just get to work.
Author: Chuck Close

Quote: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice; In practice, there is.
Author: Chuck Reid

Quote: When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President. Now I'm beginning to believe it.
Author: Clarence Darrow

Quote: Laughing at our mistakes can lengthen our own life. Laughing at someone else's can shorten it.
Author: Cullen Hightower

Quote: There are many who dare not kill themselves for fear of what the neighbors will say.
Author: Cyril Connolly

Quote: Better to write for yourself and have no public, than to write for the public and have no self.
Author: Cyril Connolly

Quote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: Never be afraid to laugh at yourself, after all, you could be missing out on the joke of the century.
Author: Dame Edna Everage

Quote: Do not condemn the judgement of another because it differs from your own. You may both be wrong.
Author: Dandemis

Quote: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
Author: Daniel J. Boorstin

Quote: Procastination is not about not doing is about not doing and feeling crappy.
Author: David Allen

Quote: You can do anything, but not everything.
Author: David Allen

Quote: It is said that power corrupts, but actually it's more true that power attracts the corruptible. The sane are usually attracted by other things than power.
Author: David Brin

Quote: A committee can make a decision that is dumber than any of its members.
Author: David Cobitz

Quote: The direct use of force is such a poor solution to any problem, it is generally employed only by small children and large nations.
Author: David Friedman

Quote: Television enables you to be entertained in your home by people you wouldn't have in your home.
Author: David Frost

Quote: Don't be afraid to take a big step if one is indicated. You can't cross a chasm in two small jumps.
Author: David Lloyd George

Quote: The tooth fairy teaches children that they can sell body parts for money.
Author: David Richerby

Quote: The more you know, the more you realise how much you don't know -- the less you know, the more you think you know.
Author: David T. Freeman

Quote: Simple, clear purpose and principles give rise to complex and intelligent behavior. Complex rules and regulations give rise to simple and stupid behavior.
Author: Dee Hock

Quote: The first step toward success will be the biggest one.
Author: Dennis Waitley

Quote: There's so much comedy on television. Does that cause comedy in the streets?
Author: Dick Cavett

Quote: It's a rare person who wants to hear what he doesn't want to hear.
Author: Dick Cavett

Quote: If your parents never had children, chances are you won't, either.
Author: Dick Cavett

Quote: There is nobody so irritating as somebody with less intelligence and more sense than we have.
Author: Don Herold

Quote: Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
Author: Don Marquis

Quote: If you are not criticized, you may not be doing much.
Author: Donald H. Rumsfeld

Quote: The art of simplicity is a puzzle of complexity.
Author: Doug Horton

Quote: Instead of giving a politician the keys to the city, it might be better to change the locks.
Author: Doug Larson

Quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: Hofstadter's Law: It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take into account Hofstadter's Law.
Author: Douglas Hofstadter

Quote: In God we trust; all others bring data.
Author: Dr. Edwards Deming

Quote: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: The best car safety device is a rear-view mirror with a cop in it.
Author: Dudley Moore

Quote: In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.
Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

Quote: I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve (or save) the world and a desire to enjoy (or savor) the world. This makes it hard to plan the day.
Author: E. B. White

Quote: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
Author: E. W. Dijkstra

Quote: I am patient with stupidity but not with those who are proud of it.
Author: Edith Sitwell

Quote: If only we'd stop trying to be happy we could have a pretty good time.
Author: Edith Wharton

Quote: Talent does what it can; genius does what it must.
Author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

Quote: Just because your voice reaches halfway around the world doesn't mean you are wiser than when it reached only to the end of the bar.
Author: Edward R. Murrow

Quote: The skill of writing is to create a context in which other people can think.
Author: Edwin Schlossberg

Quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: Normal is getting dressed in clothes that you buy for work and driving through traffic in a car that you are still paying for - in order to get to the job you need to pay for the clothes and the car, and the house you leave vacant all day so you can afford to live in it.
Author: Ellen Goodman

Quote: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
Author: Ellen Parr

Quote: I don't know anything about music. In my line you don't have to.
Author: Elvis Presley

Quote: If the human mind was simple enough to understand, we'd be too simple to understand it.
Author: Emerson Pugh

Quote: If voting changed anything, they'd make it illegal.
Author: Emma Goldman

Quote: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
Author: Epitectus

Quote: You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.
Author: Eric Hoffer

Quote: When people are free to do as they please, they usually imitate each other.
Author: Eric Hoffer

Quote: The opposite of the religious fanatic is not the fanatical atheist but the gentle cynic who cares not whether there is a god or not.
Author: Eric Hoffer

Quote: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
Author: Erica Jong

Quote: Courage is grace under pressure.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: You can't get away from yourself by moving from one place to another. There's nothing to that.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: A happy life is just a string of happy moments. But most people don't allow the happy moment, because they're so busy trying to get a happy life.
Author: Esther Hicks

Quote: Being in politics is like being a football coach. You have to be smart enough to understand the game, and dumb enough to think it's important.
Author: Eugene McCarthy

Quote: Character is what you have left when you've lost everything you can lose.
Author: Evan Esar

Quote: America believes in education: the average professor earns more money in a year than a professional athlete earns in a whole week.
Author: Evan Esar

Quote: We confess our little faults to persuade people that we have no large ones.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quote:
Watch your thoughts; they become words. 

Watch your words; they become actions. 

Watch your actions; they become habits. 

Watch your habits; they become character. 

Watch your character; it becomes your destiny.
Author: Lao Tze

Quote: We should be taught not to wait for inspiration to start a thing. Action always generates inspiration. Inspiration seldom generates action.
Author: Frank Tibolt

Quote: Writing about music is like dancing about architecture.
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: The trouble with being punctual is that nobody's there to appreciate it.
Author: Franklin P. Jones

Quote: Experience is that marvelous thing that enables you to recognize a mistake when you make it again.
Author: Franklin P. Jones

Quote: A celebrity is a person who works hard all his life to become well known, then wears dark glasses to avoid being recognized.
Author: Fred Allen

Quote: Insanity in individuals is something rare - but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Education... has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading.
Author: G. M. Trevelyan

Quote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.
Author: Galileo Galilei

Quote: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.
Author: Galileo Galilei

Quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
Author: Gandhi

Quote: My friends tell me I have an intimacy problem. But they don't really know me.
Author: Garry Shandling

Quote: I've been trying for some time to develop a lifestyle that doesn't require my presence.
Author: Gary Trudeau

Quote: Everyone is a genius at least once a year. The real geniuses simply have their bright ideas closer together.
Author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

Quote: My way of joking is to tell the truth. It is the funniest joke in the world.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The fact that a believer is happier than a skeptic is no more to the point than the fact that a drunken man is happier than a sober one.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all other countries because you were born in it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Too bad the only people who know how to run the country are busy driving cabs and cutting hair.
Author: George Burns

Quote: You know you're getting old when you stop to tie your shoelaces and wonder what else you could do while you're down there.
Author: George Burns

Quote: It takes only one drink to get me drunk. The trouble is, I can't remember if it's the thirteenth or the fourteenth.
Author: George Burns

Quote: Are people more violently opposed to fur rather than leather because its much easier to harass rich women than motorcycle gangs?
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised.
Author: George F. Will

Quote: All animals are equal but some animals are more equal than others.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
Author: George Santayana

Quote: A physicist is an atom's way of knowing about atoms.
Author: George Wald

Quote: I have too much respect for the idea of God to make it responsible for such an absurd world.
Author: Georges Duhamel

Quote: Some people like my advice so much that they frame it upon the wall instead of using it.
Author: Gordon R. Dickson

Quote: 2 is not equal to 3, not even for large values of 2.
Author: Grabel's Law

Quote: Those are my principles. If you don't like them I have others.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: A child of five would understand this. Send someone to fetch a child of five.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: There is no truth. There is only perception.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: All men are frauds. The only difference between them is that some admit it. I myself deny it.
Author: H. L. Mencken

Quote: There is a great difference between worry and concern. A worried person sees a problem, and a concerned person solves a problem.
Author: Harold Stephens

Quote: I once wanted to become an atheist, but I gave up - they have no holidays.
Author: Henny Youngman

Quote: My Grandmother is over eighty and still doesn't need glasses. Drinks right out of the bottle.
Author: Henny Youngman

Quote: Think like a man of action, act like a man of thought.
Author: Henri Bergson

Quote: Science is facts; just as houses are made of stones, so is science made of facts; but a pile of stones is not a house and a collection of facts is not necessarily science.
Author: Henri Poincare

Quote: Truly great madness cannot be achieved without significant intelligence.
Author: Henrik Tikkanen

Quote: Every generation laughs at the old fashions, but follows religiously the new.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Whether you think you can or think you can't -- you are right.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: Writing is good, thinking is better. Cleverness is good, patience is better
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: The whole secret of life is to be interested in one thing profoundly and in a thousand things well.
Author: Horace Walpole

Quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quote: If the doctor told me I had six minutes to live, I'd type a little faster.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: Part of the inhumanity of the computer is that, once it is competently programmed and working smoothly, it is completely honest.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quote: Once the game is over, the King and the pawn go back in the same box.
Author: Italian Proverb

Quote: I don't deserve this award, but I have arthritis and I don't deserve that either.
Author: Jack Benny

Quote: I have enough money to last me the rest of my life, unless I buy something.
Author: Jackie Mason

Quote: It's no longer a question of staying healthy. It's a question of finding a sickness you like.
Author: Jackie Mason

Quote: The world can only be grasped by action, not by contemplation.
Author: Jacob Bronowski

Quote: Dream as if you'll live forever. Live as if you'll die today.
Author: James Dean

Quote: Too many people are thinking of security instead of opportunity. They seem more afraid of life than death.
Author: James F. Byrnes

Quote: A myth is a religion in which no one any longer believes.
Author: James Feibleman

Quote: It is better to know some of the questions than all of the answers.
Author: James Thurber

Quote: He knows all about art, but he doesn't know what he likes.
Author: James Thurber

Quote: No matter what side of the argument you are on, you always find people on your side that you wish were on the other.
Author: Jascha Heifetz

Quote: Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you is determinism; the way you play it is free will.
Author: Jawaharlal Nehru

Quote: Only the mediocre are always at their best.
Author: Jean Giraudoux

Quote: A timid person is frightened before a danger, a coward during the time, and a courageous person afterward.
Author: Jean Paul Richter

Quote: My pessimism extends to the point of even suspecting the sincerity of the pessimists.
Author: Jean Rostand

Quote: A good tool improves the way you work.¬† A great tool improves the way you think.
Author: Jeff Duntemann

Quote: A person who trusts no one can't be trusted.
Author: Jerome Blattner

Quote: I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours.
Author: Jerome K. Jerome

Quote: Sometimes the road less traveled is less traveled for a reason.
Author: Jerry Seinfeld

Quote: If God lived on earth, people would break his windows.
Author: Jewish Proverb

Quote: If the phone doesn't ring, it's me.
Author: Jimmy Buffet

Quote: We are the people our parents warned us about.
Author: Jimmy Buffett

Quote: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
Author: Joe Ancis

Quote: If it weren't for my lawyer, I'd still be in prison. It went a lot faster with two people digging.
Author: Joe Martin

Quote: It is in self-limitation that a master first shows himself.
Author: Johann Goethe

Quote: Mistrust the man who finds everything good, the man who finds everything evil and still more the man who is indifferent to everything.
Author: Johann K. Lavater

Quote: In mathematics you don't understand things. You just get used to them.
Author: Johann von Neumann

Quote: The intelligent man finds almost everything ridiculous, the sensible man hardly anything.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: The only function of economic forecasting is to make astrology look respectable.
Author: John Kenneth Galbraith

Quote: A man always has two reasons for what he does-a good one, and the real one.
Author: John Pierpont Morgan

Quote: What we think, or what we know, or what we believe is, in the end, of little consequence. The only consequence is what we do.
Author: John Ruskin

Quote: We are continually faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as insoluble problems.
Author: John W. Gardner

Quote: Half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half.
Author: John Wanamaker

Quote: Before I got married I had six theories about bringing up children; now I have six children and no theories.
Author: John Wilmot

Quote: No wise man ever wished to be younger.
Author: Jonathan Swift

Quote: Man has to suffer. When he has no real afflictions, he invents some.
Author: Jose Marti

Quote: I hate mankind, for I think myself one of the best of them, and I know how bad I am.
Author: Joseph Baretti

Quote: A fine quotation is a diamond on the finger of a man of wit, and a pebble in the hand of a fool.
Author: Joseph Roux

Quote: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.
Author: Joseph Stalin

Quote: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of someone else.
Author: Judy Garland

Quote: Imagination is the one weapon in the war against reality.
Author: Jules de Gaultier

Quote: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
Author: Jules Renard

Quote: It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society.
Author: Krishnamurti

Quote: If you want truly to understand something, try to change it.
Author: Kurt Lewin

Quote: Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: Another flaw in the human character is that everybody wants to build and nobody wants to do maintenance.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Truth over Harmony.
Author: Larry Bossidy

Quote: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.
Author: Laurence J. Peter

Quote: Any event, once it has occurred, can be made to appear inevitable by a competent historian.
Author: Lee Simonson

Quote: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Besides the noble art of getting things done, there is the noble art of leaving things undone. The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of nonessentials.
Author: Lian Yutang

Quote: Sometimes I worry about being a success in a mediocre world.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: When hungry, eat your rice; when tired, close your eyes. Fools may laugh at me, but wise men will know what I mean.
Author: Lin-Chi

Quote: The best way to have a good idea is to have lots of ideas.
Author: Linus Pauling

Quote: The highest proof of virtue is to possess boundless power without abusing it.
Author: Lord Macaulay

Quote: Life is ten percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it.
Author: Lou Holtz

Quote: Love thy neighbour as yourself, but choose your neighbourhood.
Author: Louise Beal

Quote: Wisdom is knowing the right path to take‚Ä¶ Integrity is taking it.
Author: M. H. McKee

Quote: It is more important to know where you are going than to get there quickly.
Author: Mabel Newcomber

Quote: The difference between what we do and what we are capable of doing would solve most the worlds problems.
Author: Gandhi

Quote: An eye for eye only ends up making the whole world blind.
Author: Gandhi

Quote: God has no religion.
Author: Gandhi

Quote: Education's purpose is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
Author: Malcolm Forbes

Quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new lands but seeing with new eyes.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: Most conversations are simply monologues delivered in the presence of witnesses.
Author: Margaret Millar

Quote: Times have not become more violent. They have just become more televised.
Author: Marilyn Manson

Quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
Author: Marilyn vos Savant

Quote: If everything's under control, you're going too slow.
Author: Mario Andretti

Quote: It is surprinsingly how easy it is to forget that the way to get things done is to do them.
Author: Mark Forster

Quote: The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Never argue with a fool, onlookers may not be able to tell the difference.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Most people are bothered by those passages of Scripture they do not understand, but the passages that bother me are those I do understand.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: To cease smoking is the easiest thing I ever did; I ought to know because I've done it a thousand times.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: A lie can travel halfway around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: If you eat a frog first thing in the morning, the rest of your day will be wonderful.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: If you have to eat a frog, don't look at it for too long.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: If you tell the truth you don't have to remember anything.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: It is by the goodness of God that in our country we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either of them.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Never put off until tomorrow, what you can put off until the day after tomorrow.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it's time to pause and reflect.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: When a thought is too weak to be expressed simply, simply drop it.
Author: Marquis de Vauvenargues

Quote: I don't necessarily agree with everything I say.
Author: Marshall McLuhan

Quote: There is no pleasure in having nothing to do; the fun is in having lots to do and not doing it.
Author: Mary Wilson Little

Quote: If God wanted us to fly, He would have given us tickets.
Author: Mel Brooks

Quote: The coward dies a thousand deaths, the brave man...only five hundred.
Author: Meredith Willson

Quote: I can accept failure, but I can't accept not trying.
Author: Michael Jordan

Quote: The more you can dream, the more you can do.
Author: Michael Korda

Quote: You don't stop laughing because you grow old. You grow old because you stop laughing.
Author: Michael Pritchard

Quote: Arithmetic is being able to count up to twenty without taking off your shoes.
Author: Mickey Mouse

Quote: A man who fears suffering is already suffering from what he fears.
Author: Montaigne

Quote: We can do no great things, only small things with great love.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: A complex system that does not work is invariably found to have evolved from a simpler system that worked just fine.
Author: Murphy's Law of Computing

Quote: Never ascribe to malice, that which can be explained by incompetence.
Author: Napoleon (Hanlon's Razor)

Quote: History is the version of past events that people have decided to agree upon.
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quote: I've gone into hundreds of [fortune-teller's parlors], and have been told thousands of things, but nobody ever told me I was a policewoman getting ready to arrest her.
Author: New York City detective

Quote: The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth.
Author: Niels Bohr

Quote: I like long walks, especially when they are taken by people who annoy me.
Author: Noel Coward

Quote: Insane people are always sure that they are fine. It is only the sane people who are willing to admit that they are crazy.
Author: Nora Ephron

Quote: When you go into court you are putting your fate into the hands of twelve people who weren't smart enough to get out of jury duty.
Author: Norm Crosby

Quote: There is no greater impotence in all the world like knowing you are right and that the wave of the world is wrong, yet the wave crashes upon you.
Author: Norman Mailer

Quote: Heroism consists of hanging on one minute longer.
Author: Norwegian saying

Quote: You probably wouldn't worry about what people think of you if you could know how seldom they do.
Author: Olin Miller

Quote: The little I know I owe to my ignorance.
Author: Orville Mars

Quote: What the world needs is more geniuses with humility, there are so few of us left.
Author: Oscar Levant

Quote: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: True friends stab you in the front.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I am not young enough to know everything.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Truth, in matters of religion, is simply the opinion that has survived.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written or badly written.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not, and a sense of humor was provided to console him for what he is.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Laws are like sausages. It's better not to see them being made.
Author: Otto von Bismarck

Quote: Action is the foundational key to all success.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up.
Author: Paul Valery

Quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
Author: Peter F. Drucker

Quote: Some people have so much respect for their superiors they have none left for themselves.
Author: Peter McArthur

Quote: Wise men talk because they have something to say; fools, because they have to say something.
Author: Plato

Quote: Write drunk, revise sober.
Author: Poet's Motto

Quote: I have yet to see any problem, however complicated, which, when you looked at it in the right way, did not become still more complicated.
Author: Poul Anderson

Quote: Technology is dominated by two types of people: those who understand what they do not manage, and those who manage what they do not understand.
Author: Putt's Law

Quote: Some things have to be believed to be seen.
Author: Ralph Hodgson

Quote: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
Author: Ralph W. Sockman

Quote: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: You have to know how to accept rejection and reject acceptance.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities; an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.
Author: Reginald B. Mansell

Quote: Grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, courage to change thing I can, and wisdom to know the difference.
Author: Reinhold Niebuhr

Quote: Each problem that I solved became a rule which served afterwards to solve other problems.
Author: Rene Descartes

Quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
Author: Rich Cook

Quote: I quit therapy because my analyst was trying to help me behind my back.
Author: Richard Lewis

Quote: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.
Author: Rita Mae Brown

Quote: An undefined problem has an infinite number of solutions.
Author: Robert A. Humphrey

Quote: Understanding is simple. Knowing is complicated.
Author: Robert Fripp

Quote: A jury consists of twelve persons chosen to decide who has the better lawyer.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I--/ I took the one less traveled by, / And that has made all the difference.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: While I am opposed to all orthodox creeds, I have a creed myself; and my creed is this. Happiness is the only good. The time to be happy is now. The place to be happy is here. The way to be happy is to make others so. This creed is somewhat short, but it is long enough for this life, strong enough for this world. If there is another world, when we get there we can make another creed.
Author: Robert Green Ingersoll

Quote: Progress isn't made by early risers. It's made by lazy men trying to find easier ways to do something.
Author: Robert Heinlein

Quote: The only Zen you find on the tops of mountains is the Zen you bring up there.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig

Quote: It is a puzzling thing. The truth knocks on the door and you say, 'Go away, I'm  looking  for the truth.' and so it goes away. Puzzling.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig

Quote: When one person suffers from a delusion It is called insanity. When many people suffer from a delusion It is called Religion.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig

Quote: There's so much pollution in the air now that if it weren't for our lungs there'd be no place to put it all.
Author: Robert Orben

Quote: We've heard that a million monkeys at a million keyboards could produce the complete works of Shakespeare; now, thanks to the Internet, we know that is not true.
Author: Robert Wilensky

Quote: If the automobile had followed the same development cycle as the computer, a Rolls-Royce would today cost $100, get a million miles per gallon, and explode once a year, killing everyone inside.
Author: Robert X. Cringely

Quote: I haven't spoken to my wife in years. I didn't want to interrupt her.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: My wife and I were happy for twenty years. Then we met.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: If there's only one answer, then this must not be a very interesting topic.
Author: Ron Jeffries

Quote: Nobody believes the official spokesman... but everybody trusts an unidentified source.
Author: Ron Nesen

Quote: Abortion is advocated only by persons who have themselves been born.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: After twelve years of therapy my psychiatrist said something that brought tears to my eyes. He said, 'No hablo ingles.'
Author: Ronnie Shakes

Quote: Inanimate objects are classified scientifically into three major categories - those that don't work, those that break down and those that get lost.
Author: Russell Baker

Quote: O Lord, help me to be pure, but not yet.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: There are more tears shed over answered prayers than over unanswered prayers.
Author: Saint Theresa of Jesus

Quote: You almost never get the pleasure of seeing that you won the argument in real time. People just don't like to publicly change their minds. They change their minds in private.
Author: Sam Harris

Quote: What shapes our lives are the questions we ask, refuse to ask, or never think to ask.
Author: Sam Keen

Quote: Somewhere on this globe, every ten seconds, there is a woman giving birth to a child. She must be found and stopped.
Author: Sam Levenson

Quote: It's so simple to be wise. Just think of something stupid to say and then don't say it.
Author: Sam Levenson

Quote: What is written without effort is in general read without pleasure.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: Your manuscript is both good and original, but the part that is good is not original and the part that is original is not good.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: If there are no stupid questions, then what kind of questions do stupid people ask? Do they get smart just in time to ask questions?
Author: Scott Adams

Quote: If you can eliminate all the other choices, the remaining choice, no matter how improbable, is the answer.
Author: Sherlock Holmes

Quote: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's there are few.
Author: Shunryu Suzuki

Quote: An honest politician is one who, when he is bought, will stay bought.
Author: Simon Cameron

Quote: An honest politician is one who, when he is bought, will stay bought.
Author: Simon Cameron

Quote: Not only is the universe stranger than we imagine, it is stranger than we can imagine.
Author: Sir Arthur Eddington

Quote: I don't mind what language an opera is sung in so long as it is a language I don't understand.
Author: Sir Edward Appleton

Quote: By all means marry. If you get a good wife, you'll be happy. If you get a bad one, you'll become a philosopher... and that is a good thing for any man.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
Author: Socrates

Quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
Author: Socrates

Quote: To a brave man, good and bad luck are like his left and right hand. He uses both.
Author: St Catherine of Siena

Quote: When you're young, you look at television and think, There's a conspiracy. The networks have conspired to dumb us down. But when you get a little older, you realize that's not true. The networks are in business to give people exactly what they want. That's a far more depressing thought. Conspiracy is optimistic! You can shoot the bastards!
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Failure to plan ahead on your part does not create an emergency on my part.
Author: Steven Dutch

Quote: With or without religion, you would have good people doing good things and evil people doing evil things. But for good people to do evil things, that takes religion.
Author: Steven Weinberg

Quote: Millions long for immortality who do not know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
Author: Susan Erz

Quote: Fortune does not change men, it unmasks them.
Author: Suzanne Necker

Quote: When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?'
Author: Sydney J. Harris

Quote: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.
Author: Sydney Smith

Quote: If I had to live my life again, I'd make the same mistakes, only sooner.
Author: Tallulah Bankhead

Quote: We don't see the things the way they are. We see things the way WE are.
Author: Talmund

Quote: If I only had a little humility, I'd be perfect.
Author: Ted Turner

Quote: There is nothing so easy but that it becomes difficult when you do it reluctantly.
Author: Terence

Quote: Every great advance in natural knowledge has involved the absolute rejection of authority.
Author: Thomas H. Huxley

Quote: Try to learn something about everything and everything about something.
Author: Thomas H. Huxley

Quote: The way to succeed is to double your error rate.
Author: Thomas J. Watson

Quote: In archaeology you uncover the unknown. In diplomacy you cover the known.
Author: Thomas Pickering

Quote: When a person can no longer laugh at himself, it is time for others to laugh at him.
Author: Thomas Szasz

Quote: Invention is the mother of necessity.
Author: Thorstein Veblen

Quote: I have such a high regard for the truth that I use it sparingly.
Author: Timothy Connor

Quote: Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.
Author: Timothy Leary

Quote: A cult is a religion with no political power.
Author: Tom Wolfe

Quote: The best way to get a better answer is to start asking a better question.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: The things you own end up owning you.
Author: Tyler Durden, in Fight Club

Quote: The real hero is always a hero by mistake; he dreams of being an honest coward like everybody else.
Author: Umberto Eco

Quote: Nobody knows the age of the human race, but everybody agrees that it is old enough to know better.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Learn from the mistakes of others, because you can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Opportunity may knock only once, but temptation leans on the doorbell.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Quidquid latine dictum sit, altum sonatur.  (Whatever is said in Latin sounds profound.)
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: I wish I was as certain about anything, as he is about everything.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Management works within the system. Leadership works on the system.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: There are 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary, and those who don't.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: I would love to change the world, but they won't give me the source code.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: If you don't know where you're going, you don't know when you're lost.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Be kind to unkind people - they need it the most.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: It takes about ten years to get used to how old you are.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: To fight a bull when you are not scared is nothing. And to not fight a bull when you are scared is nothing. But to fight a bull when you are scared is something.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Some people have nothing very well organized. And some people have nothing, very well organized.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: What if this weren't a hypothetical question?
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: The fact that no one understands you doesn't mean you're an artist.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Tell a man there are 300 Billion stars in the universe and he'll believe you. Tell him a bench has wet paint on it and he'll have to touch to be sure.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: A wise man can see more from the bottom of a well than a fool can from a mountain top.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Discipline is just choosing between what you want now and what you want most.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: When an ordinary man attains knowledge he is a sage; when a sage attains understanding he is an ordinary man.
Author: Unknown author

Quote: Never try to please everyone. Your goal should be to become the hated enemy of certain kinds of people.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Everyone is entitled to be stupid, but some abuse the privilege.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: The richest man is not he who has the most, but he who needs the least.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Work like you don't need money, love like you've never been hurt, and dance like no one's watching
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Experience is a hard teacher because she gives the test first, the lesson afterwards.
Author: Vernon Sanders Law

Quote: Laughter is the shortest distance between two people.
Author: Victor Borge

Quote: I don't mind what Congress does, as long as they don't do it in the streets and frighten the horses.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: Try a thing you haven't done three times. Once, to get over the fear of doing it. Twice, to learn how to do it. And a third time, to figure out whether you like it or not.
Author: Virgil Garnett Thomson

Quote: Among those whom I like or admire, I can find no common denominator, but among those whom I love, I can: all of them make me laugh.
Author: W. H. Auden

Quote: The very best thing you can do for the whole world is to make the most of yourself.
Author: Wallace Wattles

Quote: You've achieved success in your field when you don't know whether what you're doing is work or play.
Author: Warren Beatty

Quote: It makes more sense to buy a wonderful business at a fair price than it does to buy a fair business at a wonderful price.
Author: Warren Buffet

Quote: You miss 100 percent of the shots you never take.
Author: Wayne Gretzky

Quote: Always and never are two words you should always remember never to use.
Author: Wendell Johnson

Quote: Research is what I'm doing when I don't know what I'm doing.
Author: Wernher von Braun

Quote: The truth is that there is nothing noble in being superior to somebody else. The only real nobility is in being superior to your former self.
Author: Whitney Young

Quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: The trouble with being poor is that it takes up all of your time.
Author: Willem de Kooning

Quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
Author: William Arthur Ward

Quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
Author: William Blake

Quote: It is impossible to defeat an ignorant man in argument.
Author: William G. McAdoo

Quote: The future is here. It's just not widely distributed yet.
Author: William Gibson

Quote: I feel like a fugitive from the law of averages.
Author: William H. Mauldin

Quote: After one look at this planet any visitor from outer space would say I want to see the manager.
Author: William S. Burroughs

Quote: When two men in business always agree, one of them is unnecessary.
Author: William Wrigley Jr.

Quote: I respect faith, but doubt is what gets you an education.
Author: Wilson Mizner

Quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: I took a speed reading course and read 'War and Peace' in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: If you're not failing every now and again, it's a sign you're not doing anything very innovative.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: No one goes there nowadays, it's too crowded.
Author: Yogi Berra

Quote: Before enlightnment, chop wood, carry water. After enlightnment, chop wood, carry water.
Author: Zen proverb

Quote: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing - that's why we recommend it daily.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: When I read about the evils of drinking, I gave up reading.
Author: Henny Youngman

Quote: It's no wonder that truth is stranger than fiction. Fiction has to make sense.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: When your friends begin to flatter you on how young you look, it's a sure sign you're getting old.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Sometimes when reading Goethe I have the paralyzing suspision that he is trying to be funny.
Author: Guy Davenport

Quote: Seriousness is the only refuge of the shallow.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Honest criticism is hard to take, particularly from a relative, a friend, an acquaintance, or a stranger.
Author: Franklin P. Jones

Quote: A conclusion is the place where you got tired thinking.
Author: Martin H. Fischer

Quote: Never believe anything until it has been officially denied.
Author: Claud Cockburn

Quote: I've done the calculation and your chances of winning the lottery are identical whether you play or not.
Author: Fran Lebowitz

Quote: First we make our habits, then our habits make us.
Author: Charles C. Noble

Quote: The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: Until you've lost your reputation, you never realize what a burden it was.
Author: Margaret Mitchell

Quote: A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is  for other people.
Author: Thomas Manne

Quote: I never apologize. I'm sorry, but that's just the way I am.
Author: Homer Simpson

Quote: The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you've got it made.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: Never try and teach a pig to think ... It doesn't work, and will only upset the pig.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: A genius! For 37 years I've practised fourteen hours a day, and now they call me a genius!
Author: Pablo Sarasate (Spanish Violinist)

Quote: If you have built castles in the air, your work need not be lost; that is where they should be.  Now put foundations under them.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: The nice thing about standards is that there are so many of them to choose from.
Author: Andrew S. Tanenbaum

Quote: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: My definition of an expert in any field is a person who knows enough about what's really going on to be scared.
Author: P. J. Plauger

Quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: 'Someday' is the day after you die.
Author: Steve Pavlina

Quote: I can't understand why a person will take a year to write a novel when he can easily buy one for a few dollars.
Author: Fred Allen

Quote: Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
Author: Buddha

Quote: Who is wise? He who learns from all men.
Author: Ben Zoma

Quote: Dream is not the thing what you see in sleep, dream is the thing that does not let you sleep.
Author: Adbul Kalam

Quote: If people knew how hard I had to work to gain my mastery, it wouldn't seem so wonderful at all.
Author: Michelangelo

Quote: When I was young, I observed that nine out of ten things I did were failures. So I did ten times more work.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There are only two ways of telling the complete truth--anonymously and posthumously.
Author: Thomas Sowell

Quote: When a thing is funny, search it carefully for a hidden truth.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Don't worry about the world coming to an end today. It's already tomorrow in Australia.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: Tomorrow is often the busiest day of the week.
Author: Spanish Proverb

Quote: When I'm working on a problem, I never think about beauty. I think only how to solve the problem. But when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong.
Author: R. Buckminster Fuller

Quote:
Life is based on perception,

Perception is based on opinion,

Opinion is based on thought,

Thought comes from the mind.

Change your mind , change your life.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: You can never get enough of what you don't really need.
Author: Eric Hoffer

Quote: Time is that quality of nature which keeps events from happening all at once. Lately it doesn't seem to be working
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: An incompetent attorney can delay a trial for months or years. A competent attorney can delay one even longer.
Author: Evelle J. Younger

Quote: I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quote: Practice doesn't make perfect. Perfect practice makes perfect.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Never judge a book by its movie.
Author: J. W. Eagan

Quote: The more things a man is ashamed of, the more respectable he is.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I can picture in my mind a world without war, a world without hate. And I can picture us attacking that world, because they'd never expect it.
Author: Jack Handey

Quote: A man is but the product of his thoughts; what he thinks, he becomes.
Author: Gandhi

Quote: Why does the Air Force need expensive new bombers? Have the people we've been bombing over the years been complaining?
Author: George Wallace

Quote: Before you go and criticize the younger generation, just remember who raised them.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I have been through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Time is the stuff life is made of.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
Author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

Quote: Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: I hope that while so many people are out smelling the flowers, someone is taking the time to plant some.
Author: Herbert Rappaport

Quote: When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Silence is so accurate.
Author: Mark Rothko

Quote: Money doesn't change you; it reveals who you are when you no longer have to be nice.
Author: Unknown Author

Quote: Quiet is the absence of sound. Silence is the presence of silence.
Author: Robert Fripp

Quote: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
Author: H. L. Mencken

Quote: If you don't make mistakes, you're not working on hard enough problems. And that's a big mistake.
Author: Frank Wilczek

Quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable one persists to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.
Author: Harry Truman

Quote: I don't care what is written about me so long as it isn't true.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: I don't know if God exists, but it would be better for His reputation if He didn't.
Author: Jules Renard

Quote: The bad news is time flies. The good news is you're the pilot.
Author: Michael Althsuler

Quote: The art of progress is to preserve order amid change and to preserve change amid order.
Author: Alfred North Whitehead

Quote: You can tell whether a man is clever by his answers. You can tell whether a man is wise by his questions.
Author: Naguib Mahfouz

Quote: The difference between death and taxes is death doesn't get worse every time Congress meets.
Author: Will Rogers
